snippet: Foreign Secretary William Hague said on Thursday that Britain would pay around $30 million to more than 5,000 victims of abuse in its former East African colony.
abstract: British Foreign Secretary William Hague says Britain will pay about $30 million in compensation to more than 5,000 victims of abuse in its former East African colony of Kenya; statement falls short of full apology to the Kenyans who confronted British colonial forces during the Mau Mau uprising; about 12,000 Africans died in revolt leading up to nation's independence in 1963.
lead_paragraph: Foreign Secretary William Hague said on Thursday that Britain would pay around $30 million to more than 5,000 victims of abuse in its former East African colony.

headline.seo: Britain Acknowledges Colonial-Era Torture in Kenya
headline.main: Britain to Compensate Kenyan Victims of Colonial-Era Torture
headline.print_headline: Britain to Compensate Kenyan Victims of Colonial-Era Torture

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
